thread.title: Notre Dame, Navy putting twist on alternate uniforms
thread.title_full: Notre Dame, Navy putting twist on alternate uniforms

title: Notre Dame, Navy putting twist on alternate uniforms
text:
Notre Dame, Navy putting twist on alternate uniforms FOX Sports 
Oct 5, 2015 at 5:04p ET + 
Notre Dame and Navy have a unique connection. Matt Cashore / USA Today Sports FOX Sports   5:04p ET 
Hardly a week goes by that some team isn't wearing an alternate uniform these days in college football. 
Notre Dame and Navy have both taken their turns at the practice, but they are planning something unique Saturday when they renew their annual rivalry on the gridiron. 
The Fighting Irish and Midshipmen will wear matching base layers that bear the words, "Respect, Honor, Tradition" on the sleeves as well as the palms of their gloves. 
The teams will also wear matching cleats. true â€” Notre Dame Football (@NDFootball) October 5, 2015 Each team's gloves feature Respect. Honor. Tradition. Celebrating a long standing rivalry since October 15, 1927 pic.twitter.com/pXdWGM3ueU â€” Notre Dame Football (@NDFootball) October 5, 2015 And the UA Highlight's for Saturday's game... Well they speak for themselves.ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥ pic.twitter.com/m93NHehbSw â€” Notre Dame Football (@NDFootball) October 5, 2015 
According to a news release from Navy, coaches and other sideline personnel will also wear matching gear during the game. MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters.
